direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods send STUN messages (Indication and RawMessage) to a specified destination through a specified socket, handling similar exception scenarios.
Both methods send different types of data (ChannelData and RawMessage) through specified transport addresses, managing similar exception handling and message sending logic.
Both methods involve sending messages (Request and RawMessage) through specified transport addresses, managing transactions, and handling exceptions similarly.
Both methods handle exceptions related to message sending (StunException, IOException, IllegalArgumentException) in a similar manner.
Both methods interact with the network stack to send or handle messages, involving similar resource access patterns.
Both methods in NetAccessManager send byte arrays (RawMessage and generic byte array) through specified transport addresses, with similar parameter handling and exception management.
